title: Ticket #7450: Make unique tokens on creation and log to the AuditLog
description:
Whenever we sign a token, we should:
  • Embed a unique UUID into the token via the JTI mechanism.
  • Log relevant information (decoded token contents, who triggered the creation) to the audit log.
remarks:
2020-Jan-15 13:49:09 by tlmiller:
Code Review

  • Why is the token audited with (only) its ID in one place (if it has one, and its payload otherwise), and unconditionally with its payload in another?
    • Condor_Auth_Passwd::setup_shared_keys()
    • Condor_Auth_Passwd::generate_token()

Otherwise this looks pretty good.

2020-Feb-01 14:58:13 by bbockelm:
The original intent is that if we audit the payload with the token generation (in = generate_token=) then we can just log the ID when the token is used (in = setup_shared_keys =); you can always perform a join between the two lines if you want the payload.

In retrospect, however ... that's making the admin do a lot of extra work for a remarkably small savings of characters in the log. I changed it to log the payload unconditionally in both cases.

2020-Feb-03 10:42:26 by tlmiller:
Code Review

Change makes sense to me. Merged.
